sendaman69 wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I already posted this a while ago, but didn't get a response! Anyone got a hint on the following problem!
> 
> I was using the the seed http://www.jku.at (domain of my university) to develop and test my focused crawler based on heritrix 2. With this seed crawling worked fine.
> 
> Now I tried to use other random seed domains (e.g. http://www.archive.org) and suddenly my crawl stalls right at the start?!?
> 
> If I use the IP adresses instead of the domain names as seeds the crawl stops and does not stall!?

What is the difference between "stalls" and "stops" in the preceding two 
sentences?

> I get "Failed to crawl seed, will retry" in the seed report.

Is there any other number in this report?

Is there anything in the 'crawl.log', 'heritrix_out.log', or other logs 
(runtime-errors, local/nonfatal-errors) referring to the seeds which are 
not crawled, or indicating other errors?

Does the crawl.log show success for the automatic prerequisites of the 
seed URI (eg: dns:www.archive.org and http://www.archive.org/robots.txt)?

> I tried it with the standard unchanged 2.0.2 distribution and the standard profiles and got the same result?!?

Starting from a standard profile, and simply making the minimal changes 
necessary to enable a crawl (adding seeds and a custom user-agent), 
should have no problem at least attempting the seeds.

> Anyone got an explanation for this strange behavior?
> 
> Im running on windows and from localhost:8080 from my home (which is not part of the jku.at domain)

Which Windows?

While Heritrix works on Windows -- indeed my primary development machine 
is WindowsXP -- our primary target platform is Linux. So it's possible 
some things will be flaky in a Windows environment, especially if using 
something we haven't ever tested (like Vista/Win7, running the crawl 
from/to Windows network volumes, running at odd installation paths, etc.).

I would expect any such problems to generate noticeable errors in the 
UI, heritrix_out.log, or elsewhere, though.

- Gordon @ IA


> Thanks for any help
> 
> Georgie
